citation.article-title: Bacillus okuhidensis sp. nov., isolated from the Okuhida spa area of Japan.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bacillus okuhidensis sp. nov.
Bacillus okuhidensis (ok.u.hid.en«sis. N.L. masc. adj. okuhidensis pertaining to Okuhida in Gifu, Japan, where the strains were initially isolated)
Cells are rod-shaped with a length of approx. 5-7 μm and a width of 0.5-1.0 μm.
Cells are motile by means of peritrichous flagella, and produce terminally located ellipsoidal spores.
Colonies are circular, convex, smooth and yellowish.
Cells stain slightly Gram-positive in the exponential growth phase but Gram-negative in the stationary growth phase.
Catalase and oxidase reactions are positive.
The temperature range for growth is 30-60°C, the optimum being 45-50°C.
The pH range for growth is 6.0-11.0, the optimum being pH 10.5.
Branched saturated fatty acids iso-C15:0 (43.7%±0.7%) and anteiso-C15:0 (25.8%±0.6%) represent the major cellular fatty acids.
Casein, starch and gelatin are hydrolysed.
Hippurate and Tween 20, 40 and 60 are not hydrolysed.

Utilizes salicin, glycogen, inositol, melibiose, gentiobiose, l-arabinose, sorbitol, D-xylose, turanose, galactose, rhamnose, lactose, D-mannitol, glycerol, arabitol, N-acetylglucosamine and xylitol, but not mannose, D-tagatose, raffinose or melezitose (utilization data were obtained with Biolog).
The G+C content of the DNA is 41.0-41.1 mol% (determined by HPLC).
